Uses of Package
net.sf.jgcs

  • Packages that use net.sf.jgcs 
    Package Description
    net.sf.jgcs
    Defines a generic interface for group communication.
    net.sf.jgcs.annotation
    Defines optional annotations for messages.
    net.sf.jgcs.spi
    Supports service providers with a set of abstract classes that ease the implementation of bindings to concrete group communication protocols.
  • Classes in net.sf.jgcs used by net.sf.jgcs 
    Class and Description
    Annotation
    Annotations provide optional semantic information to the protocol.
    BlockListener
    Application interface for delivering block notifcations.
    ClosedSessionException
    Thrown when trying to use a closed session.
    ControlSession
    Allows a process to control its participation in a process group.
    DataSession
    Allows a process to multicast and deliver messages in a process group.
    ExceptionListener
    Application interface for delivering asynchronous exceptions.
    GroupConfiguration
    A process group identifier.
    GroupException
    Thrown when there is an exception with group communication.
    InvalidStateException
    Thrown when an operation cannot be performed in the current group state.
    Membership
    A group membership configuration.
    MembershipID
    Uniquely identifies each membership configuration.
    MembershipListener
    Application interface for delivering group membership change notifications.
    MembershipSession
    Allows the application to know the current group composition.
    Message
    This class defines a Message.
    MessageListener
    Application interface for delivering message payloads.
    Protocol
    A protocol instance is the main entry point for group communication.
    Service
    A service defines a delivery guarantee, such as reliability or order.
    ServiceListener
    Application interface for delivering service notifications.
  • Classes in net.sf.jgcs used by net.sf.jgcs.annotation 
    Class and Description
    Annotation
    Annotations provide optional semantic information to the protocol.
  • Classes in net.sf.jgcs used by net.sf.jgcs.spi 
    Class and Description
    BlockListener
    Application interface for delivering block notifcations.
    BlockSession
    Allows flushing the group after a block notification.
    ControlSession
    Allows a process to control its participation in a process group.
    DataSession
    Allows a process to multicast and deliver messages in a process group.
    ExceptionListener
    Application interface for delivering asynchronous exceptions.
    GroupConfiguration
    A process group identifier.
    GroupException
    Thrown when there is an exception with group communication.
    InvalidStateException
    Thrown when an operation cannot be performed in the current group state.
    Membership
    A group membership configuration.
    MembershipID
    Uniquely identifies each membership configuration.
    MembershipListener
    Application interface for delivering group membership change notifications.
    MembershipSession
    Allows the application to know the current group composition.
    MessageListener
    Application interface for delivering message payloads.
    Protocol
    A protocol instance is the main entry point for group communication.
    ServiceListener
    Application interface for delivering service notifications.
